body:
same occasional behaviour here : connection to webdav is suddently stalled,
transfers stop, and finally everything timeouts. especially with windows
and macosx builtin clients. i spent quite some time investigating,
particularly the several fastcgi timeouts (in apache 2.4 mod_proxy_fcgi and
in php) with no real success. logs are not helpful. i just see that some
php process childs die in a suspect manner, and sometimes a restart of
php-fpm process is necessary. to sum it up, ive not be able to decide if
root cause lies in owncloud, php, apache, mod_prxy_fcgi, my configuration,
or everybody :(

(incidently, i would not recommend apache 2.4 + mod_proxy_fcgi for
owncloud. its doesnt respect correctly the fastcgi spec about request,
path_info, script_name and so on, so deploying owncloud requires a bit of
nonsense patching of lib/request.php. i'm considering delegating owncloud
to a nginx instance.)

regards,
stephane

the reason for stalling webdav request is most of the time that the webserver is not launching new processes to handle the requests. the reason is probably that there are already a lot or http processes running the the maxclients limit is reached. so the nextstep to debug this is to check why there are running php/owncloud processes and what they are doing. i suggest to enable mod_status in apache to check what this processes are doing and also look intot the error logs.

i use mod_event with :

    startservers             3
    serverlimit             16
    minsparethreads         75
    maxsparethreads        250
    threadsperchild         25
    maxrequestworkers      400 (--> maxclients in apache 2.4)
    maxconnectionsperchild   0

what values do you guys typically have for small owncloud installs ?

yet i doubt its the cause. php segfaults wouldnt occur if it was the only
problem.

regards,
stephane
